definition: to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Agence France-Presse reported that someone threw firebombs exploded toward the embassy.
sentences.chinese: 法新社报道，有人朝使馆投掷燃烧弹引发爆炸。

sentences.english: Its protesters are determined not to use rocks or firebombs.
sentences.chinese: 它的抗议民众决定不使用石块或者燃烧弹。

sentences.english: Strikers fought back, hurling firebombs at police, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，罢工工人向警方投掷燃烧弹还击。

sentences.english: Napalm or grenades can also be effective, but be careful!
sentences.chinese: 燃烧弹和手榴弹效果也很好，但要注意。

sentences.english: Five shops were damaged in a firebomb blitz .
sentences.chinese: 在一次燃烧弹袭击中有五家店铺被烧毁。

sentences.english: Riot police officers ran from the flames of a firebomb outside the American Embassy in Athens during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 防爆警察正从美国大使馆外面的燃烧弹火焰中冲出来。
